language.entry: {colour_start|help_panel_controls}Controls{colour_end}
{colour_start|help_panel_controls}Back{colour_end}
Get Help Where You May!
Kill the Enemy!
Map Navigation
Hallway Movement
Interactive Objects (Curios)
Bandaging
Curing Blight
The Torch
Provision for the Journey
Remap Combat Skills
Remap Camping Skills
Firewood and Camping
The Benefits of Camping
Stress Relief
Afflicted!
Virtuous!
Death's Door
Discretion is the better part of valor...
Disarming Traps
Entering Doors
Stress
Trinkets
Party Formation
Resolve Level Up!
The Stagecoach is Your Hero Lifeblood
A Body's Limit: Heart Attack
The Hero Panel
Completing a Quest
Treatment
Monsters with High PROT
Severe Negative Quirks
Sell Back Trinkets

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's {colour_start|notable}image or portrait{colour_end} at any time to bring up a detailed panel showing all of the hero's {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}, {colour_start|notable}skills{colour_end}, and {colour_start|notable}resistances{colour_end}.

After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to town{colour_end} at any time--just {colour_start|notable}click the crest{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.

The {colour_start|notable}Sanitarium{colour_end} is most often used to remove {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} and treat {colour_start|sanitarium_treatment_disease_entry}diseases{colour_end}. But you can also use it to reinforce a {colour_start|notable}positive quirk{colour_end}, which will lock it into place and prevent new positive quirks from displacing it. You can lock a maximum of 3 positive quirks per hero.

Some monsters have high {colour_start|notable}PROT{colour_end}, which {colour_start|notable}absorbs attack damage{colour_end}. DOTs ({colour_start|pop_text_poison}blight{colour_end} and {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleed{colour_end}) ignore PROT and are effective means to take down these highly armored opponents.

Over time, some {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} will lock into place and become {colour_start|notable}severe{colour_end}. Severe{colour_start|harmful} negative quirks{colour_end} cost much more to remove in the Sanitarium.

On any screen in the game, press and hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[H]{colour_end} to see contextual help for controls in that mode.
Try it while in town, exploring, fighting, camping, and more.

Combat is {colour_start|notable}turn-based{colour_end}. On your hero's turn, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} a skill icon and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a highlighted target.
If you can't select a particular skill, it's because that hero needs to be {colour_start|notable}standing in a different spot{colour_end} or there are {colour_start|notable}no valid targets{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Mouse Over]{colour_end} the skill to see the requirements.

You are currently in a {colour_start|notable}room{colour_end}.
To move forth, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on {colour_start|notable}another room{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}map display{colour_end}. This will take you to the {colour_start|notable}connecting hallway{colour_end}.

While in a {colour_start|notable}hallway{colour_end}, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[D]{colour_end} to move forward, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A]{colour_end} to move back.
If you prefer the {colour_start|notable}mouse{colour_end}, you can {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} ahead or behind the party to move them.

While exploring, you will often find {colour_start|notable}interactive objects{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} to investigate them. Take a look at this tent...

Your hero is {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleeding{colour_end}!
If you wish, you can use a {colour_start|notable}bandage{colour_end} from inventory to stop the flow. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}bandage{colour_end} while it's the injured hero's turn.

Your hero is {colour_start|pop_text_poison}blighted{colour_end}!
If you wish, you can use {colour_start|notable}anti-venom{colour_end} from inventory to neutralize it. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}anti-venom{colour_end} while it's the injured hero's turn.

The {colour_start|notable}light{colour_end} is fading! The current {colour_start|notable}torch level greatly affects many mechanics{colour_end} in the game. The darker it gets, the harder things get but the better the rewards. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a torch from inventory to boost the light back up.

You'll want to take {colour_start|notable}different supplies{colour_end} depending on what {colour_start|notable}region{colour_end} you are going to, how {colour_start|notable}long{colour_end} the quest is, and your own preferences. But always bring some {colour_start|notable}food{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}torches{colour_end}!
For your first short quest, try bringing at least 8 food and 4 torches.

Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 active combat skills{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off to change your loadout, and watch how it changes that hero's positional strength in the display above!
Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 Camping skills active{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off by clicking on them.

This quest involves {colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end}, and Camping requires {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end}. Firewood is {colour_start|notable}given automatically{colour_end} to you on appropriate quests.
{colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end} gives heroes a chance to {colour_start|notable}recuperate while in the dungeon{colour_end}. When you are wounded or {colour_start|stressNOT1}stressed{colour_end} and wish to camp, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on the firewood in your inventory.

Camping consists of two parts: {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Skill phase{colour_end}.
During the {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end}, you choose how much they eat, which determines recovery. Make sure you have enough food!
{colour_start|notable}Skill Phase{colour_end} allows you to spend {colour_start|notable}Rest Points{colour_end} on different hero skills used for recuperation.

Heroes relieve {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by taking part in activities at the {colour_start|notable}Tavern{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Abbey{colour_end}. Each activity has different side-effects.
Experiment to find the best activity for each hero, depending on their {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}!
Commiting a hero to an activity {colour_start|notable}locks them in that activity{colour_end} until the {colour_start|notable}next Week{colour_end}. You'll have to take a different hero with you on your next quest.

When heroes {colour_start|notable}can't take the {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} any more{colour_end}, they become {colour_start|harmful}afflicted{colour_end}. This manifests in {colour_start|notable}different behaviors{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}stat changes{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}Afflictions{colour_end} last until you {colour_start|notable}send them to treatment{colour_end} in town, unless you can reduce their {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} to zero during the quest.

Sometimes, heroes respond to the onslaught of {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by becoming {colour_start|notable}heroic{colour_end}!
This elevated state of performance will last until they camp or return to town, and confers {colour_start|notable}stat bonuses{colour_end} and other benefits.

When a hero is reduced to 0 HP, they are at {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end}.
While in this state, they will suffer {colour_start|notable}stat penalties{colour_end}, plus any further damage has a {colour_start|notable}chance to kill them{colour_end}.
{colour_start|notable}Heal{colour_end} them to get off {colour_start|deathdoor}Death's Door{colour_end}!

The first of many heroes has given their all in service to you. You have the option of {colour_start|notable}retreating from combat{colour_end} and abandoning this quest to save the others, or {colour_start|notable}press onward{colour_end}.
The choice is yours. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[If this is the tutorial, retreat is unavailable.]{colour_end}

Scouted {colour_start|trap}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}.
Some heroes are better than others at disarming.

To enter a {colour_start|notable}door{colour_end}, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} when standing in front of it.

Many actions and experiences cause {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} damage appears above heroes' heads, in black type. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} can also be {colour_start|notable}healed{colour_end}, and that appears in white type.

Each hero has room to equip two items, called {colour_start|notable}trinkets{colour_end}. Just {colour_start|notable}drag the trinket{colour_end} from inventory over to the {colour_start|notable}selected hero's slot{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Trinkets{colour_end} generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also class-specific.

Each quest has {colour_start|notable}different goals and rewards{colour_end}, and each region has its own challenges. Experiment with various combinations to see what works!
However, it's recommended to bring along a {colour_start|notable}Vestal{colour_end} or an {colour_start|notable}Occultist{colour_end} for healing.

Heroes gain {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} for each successful quest. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} in turn determines the hero's {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end}.
{colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} represents the hero's veteranship, and directly acts as {colour_start|notable}Stress Resistance{colour_end} against the horrors encountered in the dungeons.
A low {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} hero that tries a higher level quest will quickly crumble under the unimaginable stresses.

{colour_start|harmful}Stress{colour_end} continues to build beyond the point of {colour_start|harmful}Affliction{colour_end}.
If a hero's stress bar fills a second time completely, their {colour_start|harmful}body will give out{colour_end}. Get them aid or retreat back to town before this happens.
Death awaits us all.
Corpses

When most monsters die, they leave corpses. Corpses act as temporary obstacles and will eventually go away on their own.
You can attack corpses to destroy them faster, but often a better approach is to use ranged skills, push/pull skills, and even corpse-clearing special skills that some heroes possess.
Monsters killed with bleed, blight, or crits leave no corpses at all!
You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money. Open the Trinket Inventory and [SHIFT-CLICK] on any trinket you don't want.
Secret Rooms

A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Secret Room{colour_end}! Advance to the tile marked with a star, and press 'W' or click to enter. Fabulous wealth and riches await those equipped with a {colour_start|notable}key{colour_end}...
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero in the roster to inspect their detailed character sheet. They can be renamed or dismissed permanently from there.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on buildings to use them to interact with your heroes.
STAGECOACH: recruit new heroes
BLACKSMITH: upgrade heroes' weapons and armor
GUILD: upgrade heroes' combat skills
SURVIVALIST: upgrade heroes' Camping skills
TAVERN: send heroes for {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief
ABBEY: send heroes for {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief
SANITARIUM: treat heroes' quirks and diseases
NOMAD'S WAGON: purchase rare items
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on new heroes to inspect them.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} new heroes to your roster to recruit them.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Blacksmith to see their weapon and armor upgrade options.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on upgrades to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Blacksmith before purchasing some hero upgrades.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Guild to see their skill upgrade options.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on combat skills or combat skill upgrades to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Guild before purchasing some hero upgrades.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero in your roster to load them into the Survivalist and see their camping skill upgrade options.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on skills or upgrades to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Survivalist before purchasing some hero upgrades.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} a hero into the appropriate slot to start a {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SHIFT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a building slot to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not recover the money spent.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} a hero into the appropriate slot to start a {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SHIFT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a building slot to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not recover the money spent.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.

Treating quirks: {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} a hero into a treatment ward slot and select a positive quirk to reinforce and/or a negative quirk to remove. Severe quirks cost more to remove.
Treating diseases: {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} a hero into a medical ward slot and select a disease to treat. Sometimes extra diseases will also be cured.
Committing the hero to treatment will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional treatment slots.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SHIFT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a building slot to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not recover the money spent.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} the + icon to see upgrade options for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on available items to purchase them.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on available quests to inspect them.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on heroes or {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} them into the party slots to form an adventuring party.
Heroes that are in the Tavern, Abbey, or Sanitarium will be unavailable for use.
Complete quests in regions to advance your mastery in that region and open up new quest types.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} "PROVISION" when ready to proceed.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} items in the shop to purchase them for the expedition.
At quest end, unused provisions will be discarded without repayment. Buy only as much as you need!
You'll always want to carry some food and torches! Each hero generally eats 1 food unit per meal (Camping or Hunger event).
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a room in the map to begin moving to that room.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero to select them.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's move skill to change their party position.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on firewood in inventory (if you have any) to start CAMPING.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[MOUSE OVER]{colour_end} the torch meter to see current light level and gameplay effects.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on retreat flag to abandon the quest.
While interacting with an object: {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} an inventory item to apply it to the object. Some items will yield positive effects.

Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[MOUSEWHEEL]{colour_end} to zoom map and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} to pan map.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} a hero or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[C]{colour_end} to see their detailed character sheet.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[T]{colour_end} to use a torch from inventory.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[D]{colour_end} to walk forward, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[A]{colour_end} to walk backward.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's move skill to change their party position.
Entering Doors: When in front of a door, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on it or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end}.

Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[MOUSEWHEEL]{colour_end} to zoom map and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[DRAG]{colour_end} to pan map.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on objects or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} to interact with them. The selected hero will perform the interaction.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} a hero or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[C]{colour_end} to see their detailed character sheet.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the INVENTORY tab to examine supplies.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the PERSONALITY tab to see the current hero's quirks and afflictions.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the retreat flag to abandon the quest.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[T]{colour_end} to use a torch from inventory.

On hero's turn, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} a valid combat skill and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} a target to act. You can also use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[# keys]{colour_end} 1-5 to quickly select a skill.

Each skill has different requirements for where the hero needs to be standing and what enemies they can target. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[MOUSE OVER]{colour_end} the skill to se the requirements.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[MOUSE OVER]{colour_end} enemies to see stats and chances to hit/damage/crit with currently selected skill.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on Anti-Venom or Bandages in inventory to heal BLIGHT or BLEED on the current hero.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on Retreat Flag to attempt to retreat from the combat.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero to see their detailed character sheet.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on meal options to choose how much to eat. You are limited by how much food you have in inventory.
Your party has {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[10 ACTION POINTS]{colour_end} to spend on using Camping skills.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on their skill to use it. Some skills require a target to be selected.
When done spending ACTION POINTS, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} "REST" to finish Camping.
The Ruins bear all the signs of your Ancestor's frenzied digging...
Once-holy idols and shrines have been corrupted to favor pagan gods. Holy Water can help restore them to their rightful condition.
The undead will not bleed, but they can be blighted.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...
Each region has its own challenges. Assemble your party and supplies accordingly.
A well-placed supply item can often protect against the hazards of interactive objects you encounter.
You can retreat from combat and even abandon quests. If things are going terribly, live to fight another day.
Skeletons with high PROT are susceptible to blight attacks.
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Necromancer (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Necromancer (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Necromancer (3 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Prophet (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Prophet (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Prophet (3 / 3)
Beast and corrupted human alike inhabit these failing groves.
The Weald is full of long, winding paths. Bring plenty of torches.
Beware the mark of death that Fungal Artillery can put on you. It tells their Fungal Zombie brethren what to kill.
The paths are littered with poisonous traps.
Beast and corrupted human alike inhabit these failing groves.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...
Each region has its own challenges. Assemble your party and supplies accordingly.
A well-placed supply item can often protect against the hazards of interactive objects you encounter.
You can retreat from combat and even abandon quests. If things are going terribly, live to fight another day.
Blight and bleed damage ignore the enemy's protection (PROT).
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Hag (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Hag (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Hag (3 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Cannon (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Cannon (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Cannon (3 / 3)
The Warrens is full of disease and blight in equal measure... come prepared to deal with sickness.
The Swine are resistant to disease, thanks to their unclean living.
The tunnels are often blocked by piled stones and bodies. It's dirty work to remove by hand.
The Warrens is full of disease and blight in equal measure... come prepared to deal with sickness.
The Swine are resistant to disease, thanks to their unclean living.
These tunnels are often blocked by piled stones and bodies. It's dirty work to remove by hand.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...
Each region has its own challenges. Assemble your party and supplies accordingly.
A well-placed supply item can often protect against the hazards of interactive objects you encounter.
You can retreat from combat and even abandon quests. If things are going terribly, live to fight another day.
Blight and bleed damage ignore the enemy's protection (PROT).
Hamlet
Upon returning to the Hamlet, be sure to check the Activity Log to see what has transpired in your absence.
Stagecoach upgrades are vital to the long-term health of your roster, and your Hamlet!
Medical Ward treatments can sometimes wipe out more than one Disease.
Short on gold? Sell unwanted trinkets directly from your trinket inventory!
A red question mark on a hero's portrait indicates they are unavailable for the week.
Heroes can be renamed and recolored in the character panel.
Afflictions are removed by placing a hero in any {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} treatment activity.
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Swine Prince (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Swine Prince (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Swine Prince (3 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Flesh (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Flesh (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Flesh (3 / 3)
The fishfolk's scaled skin affords them increased resistance to bleeding attacks.
Thralls will explode if left for too long!
Tentacled Lurkers lie in wait just below the water's surface...tread carefully.
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Siren (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Siren (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Siren (3 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Drowned Crew (1 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Drowned Crew (2 / 3)
Ancestor's Memoirs - The Drowned Crew (3 / 3)
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SPACE]{colour_end} or {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} to Continue
